snippet: Zhou Youguang, 106, invented Pinyin, a spelling system that links China’s ancient written language to the modern age, and he’s using it to speak his mind.
abstract: Saturday Profile of 106-year-old Zhou Youguang, inventor of spelling system Pinyin that links China’s ancient written language to the modern age and helped country all but stamp out illiteracy; despite all his achievements, Zhou remains largely uncelebrated because he does not support Communist Party's one-party rule.
lead_paragraph: Zhou Youguang, 106, invented Pinyin, a spelling system that links China’s ancient written language to the modern age, and he’s using it to speak his mind.
